intro: Thymus angustifolius var. intermedius, commonly known as narrow-leaved thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features aromatic, narrow leaves that are typically gray-green in color and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its essential oils contain thymol and carvacrol, which contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses.
